subject: RE: [junit] JUnit extra

messageBody:
I'm not familiar with Jakarta Commons Digester, but it seems like it was
designed to make reverse (compare to my way) transformation: XML -> java
objects.

I will inherit the idea of making snapshots of log file and screen from
Netbean's Jelly, which is done by simply overriding <code>runBare</code>
method.



In general: I've found better solution. It is apparently possible to
supply custom xml formatter for <junit> ant task using attributes like:

<formatter classname="bla.bla.bla" extension=".xml" />.

Unfortunately default implementation of it (class
XMLJUnitResultFormatter.java) can not be easily extended for
customization and is lacking some functionality. :-(

So, I'm basically getting back to re-inventing the wheel, though I know
for sure the shape now :-)



Dennis.

Subject: Re: [junit] JUnit extra



Dennis N. Stetsenko wrote:

> Hello
>
>
>
> I'm trying to figure out the best way to extend/modify JUnit framework
+
> Ant Task to fit my specific needs, like:
>
> 1) I'm capturing screenshot and making snapshot of the
application
> log file on each failure/error.
>
> 2) I've extended TestCase class (ETestCase) to add extra
> information per each executed test case (unique requirement id string
->
> ETestCase.req_id)
>
> 3) In case of failure/error I add unique string id of a
screenshot
> to the ETestCase (ETestCase.picture_id)
>
>
>
> So, I want to automate execution of tests such way that I would
receive
> XML file at the end with all custom fields from ETestCase (in order to
> make html afterwards with links to screenshots/log files for every
> failed test case). Ideally that would be extension to both JUnit and
> Ant.

Try using the JUnit-addons Test Runner. It allows you to register a test

listener that will help you know when to take a snapshot of the
application log file.

For producing the XML file, register another listener that builds in
memory the object model you want to dump to XML, then use something like

the Jakarta Commons Digester to turn that object model into an XML
document.

Good luck.
